alert.note: Alert for Dunklin (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 12:29AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Greene, Clay and Dunklin Counties through 100 AM CST... At 1229 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Datto to near Paragould. Movement was northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paragould, Kennett, Piggott, Corning, Campbell, Rector, Senath, Marmaduke, Chalk Bluff Natural Area, Oak Grove Heights, Holcomb, Lafe, Knobel, St. Francis, Pollard, Greenway, McDougal, Success, Peach Orchard and Datto. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
